meanings.definition: The act of transporting goods by a horse-drawn cart.
meanings.sent1: The draying of supplies to the market was done early in the morning.
meanings.sent2: The village relied on draying to bring in fresh produce from the farms.
meanings.sent3: The draying of goods through the bumpy roads often led to spilled cargo.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to draying was as steady as the horse's trot along the path.
meanings.sent5: The sound of draying echoed through the quiet countryside, signaling the arrival of goods.

meanings.definition: The process of moving heavy items using a dray.
meanings.sent1: The draying of furniture required careful handling to avoid damage.
meanings.sent2: Workers used draying to transport the large crates to the warehouse.
meanings.sent3: The draying of the piano up the stairs was a comical sight.
meanings.sent4: The efficiency of draying made the task of moving the equipment much easier.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic clatter of draying wheels filled the loading dock with activity.

meanings.sent1: His grandfather's profession was draying, passing down the skills to him.
meanings.sent2: The draying business was thriving in the bustling city.
meanings.sent3: Becoming a drayman was his dream job since he was a child.
meanings.sent4: The drayman's expertise in draying was unmatched in the region.
meanings.sent5: The community respected the hard work put in by the drayman to keep the deliveries on time.
